Description: Mediterranean Group 3 glass alabastron or flask; core formed and trailed; almost biconical body with a narrow neck and wide disc rim; large opposing lug handles; made from translucent dark blue glass with opaque white trails, feathered above the carination and with a spiral below ending at the pointed tip of the vase; surface well preserved apart from some iridescence; rim chipped.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (340)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 118, Tomb 49)
